In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    lines = String[]
    
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        
        current_line *= " " * word
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)  # add the remaining string to lines
    
    return join(lines, "\n")   # join the lines with a newline character and return
end
```

You can now use this function on an example:

```julia
str = "This is a test string. It will be wrapped if it exceeds 10 characters."
println(wrap_string(str, 20))
```

The output of the above code would look like this:

```
This is a test
string. It will
be wrapped if it
exceeds 10
characters.
```
